intro: Mezzettia parviflora var. floribunda, commonly known as the showy mezzettia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small, white to pale pink, and appear in clusters, blooming in late spring to early summer. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
